text:
hello this is chef john from food wishes
kama lib fried cheese egg toast that's

right you want something delicious for
breakfast but none of your usual options

sound good which means you're in what we
call them the business erupted and don't

feel bad it happens to the best of us
but anyway good news if you're currently

suffering through that since fried
cheese egg toast is one of my all-time

favorite breakfast rut Buster's plus
recipes like this can actually help you

improve your cooking skills and I will
attempt to explain why later but for now

let's just go ahead and get started by
tossing a small handful of grated

cheddar cheese into this nonstick
skillet we've set over medium heat and

I'm using just under 1 ounce which is a
little bit stingy probably just over 1

ounces the perfect amount and if
possible try to get some sort of rounded

shape unlike mine which was a little
random and what we're looking for here

before we add our egg is for that cheese
to melt and start bubbling and start to

get a little bit browned around the
outside edge and once that happens we're

going to do two things one is optional
and that would be to sprinkle down some

hot pepper flakes which brings us to our
non optional second thing we will

attempt to place one large egg in the
center or somewhere close to it but

before I do I'm going to touch the
center of my cheese mixture with the tip

of my spatula for no apparent reason I
guess I was trying to make a well for

the egg to sit in but I quickly realized
you can't but anyway we'll place our egg

down trying to keep that yolk somewhere
remotely close to the center and then

what we'll do once we have our egg
positioned is take the tip of our

spatula and poke it through that
invisible membrane that sort of holds

the white together which should if
everything goes according to plan cause

some of that white to run out and sort
of flatten out and it will probably cook

a little bit quicker and more evenly and
then besides dealing with a few rogue

pieces of cheese all we're gonna do is
hang out and keep an eye on this and

basically we're waiting for that cheese
to get beautifully browned as well as

our egg way to cook almost but not quite
all the way through and at that point we

will attempt to fold this all up
hopefully in a shape remotely close to

the shape of our slice of toast and the
reason making something like this

improves your skills is because it
forces you to react to what you're

seeing and feeling in the pan okay
doesn't matter what the written recipe

says you're gonna have to decide when
exactly

fold this up which for me was right here
because they could see my cheese was

getting nicely browned and the blade was
just about set and at that point we'll

go around with our spatula scraping
everything up over the top

somehow in case scenario can that fried
cheese which as you can see has been

sort of fused to the egg white and one
of the many great things about fried

cheese is that as soon as it comes up
off that pan it basically firms up

almost immediately which makes it fairly
easy to manipulate and don't worry about

trying to get this perfect in fact this
is probably one of the worst looking

ones I've ever made but it doesn't
matter because once this is on the toast

it always looks amazing
and then what we'll do once all those

sides have been sort of folded up and
over is simply wait until we think it's

cooked long enough which is probably
only gonna be a couple seconds since

like I said we really do want to keep
that yolk runny and for mine I decided

it was perfect right here so we'll pull
that off and transfer it onto a piece of

toast
and besides pulling off any unsightly

cheese remanence I like topping this
with a few green onions and that's it

what we're calling fried cheese egg
toast is done and before I tell you why

this is such an amazing breakfast let me
have you listen to the reason

oh yeah it is the combo of that crispy
fried cheese surrounding that soft runny

egg that creates all the magic here so
let me go ahead and dig in and buy dig

in what I mean is take the tip of the
fork and bust that egg right in the yolk

and then we'll sort of strategically
spread that around so every bite has

some Jochen it all right you might be
okay with a couple of yolk list bites

but not me and then before I stick this
in my face I'm gonna finish off with a

little pinch of salt and since I hadn't
had one of these in a while I actually

forgot how unbelievably delicious
they're all right we already talked

about that contrast between the crispy
cheese and the runny egg which really is

a hard combo to beat both taste wise and
texturally just insanely good and I'm

not sure what thoughts are gonna pop
into your brain as you're eating this

but what always pops into mine is why
didn't you make two why did you not make

two right you hear people say less is
more not with this recipe

more is more oh and speaking of more if
you want to add some bacon or diced ham

to this that would be good so feel free
to accessorize since you are after all

the hosts of this fried cheese egg toast
but truth be told I really do enjoy more

in this primitive state but anyway
that's it fried cheese egg toast if this

ends up catching on we might have to
come up with a little better name but

for now we'll stick with a very simple
uneffective fried cheese egg toast and

whether you're in a breakfast rut that
needs to be busted or you just feel like

eating a runny egg with fried cheese
wrapped around it I really do hope you

give this a try soon so head over to
food wishes com for all the ingredient

amounts and more info as usual and as
always enjoy
you
you
